decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to be aggressive and control the board using a combination of efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and land destruction from Wasteland. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation to maintain consistency and adapt to the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly close out the game while staying ahead in tempo and card advantage.

The main concept of this combo deck is to use cards like Mystic Forge, Manifold Key, and Voltaic Key to generate mana and find win conditions like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. The deck aims to assemble powerful combos by utilizing artifacts and key pieces like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful spells like The One Ring and Glaring Fleshraker to overwhelm the opponent and win the game. Additionally, cards like Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide added utility and protection for the combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base by casting early disruptive threats like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, Magus of the Moon, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. It then aims to close out the game quickly with powerful aggressive creatures like Fury, Pyrogoyf, and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck also includes removal spells like Sundering Eruption and Shatterskull Smashing to deal with threats from the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes fast mana sources like Chrome Mox, Simian Spirit Guide, and City of Traitors to accelerate its game plan.

Utilizing Show and Tell to cheat powerful, high-CMC creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play for free with Omniscience in play. The deck also includes cards like Stock Up and LÃ³rien Revealed to protect the combo, along with cards like Veil of Summer and Force of Will for additional protection. The deck is built around quickly assembling the combo and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats that can be difficult to deal with, leading to a quick victory if the combo goes off successfully.

The deck focuses on using creatures to ramp up mana quickly, utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to bring out powerful creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Wight of the Reliquary. It also features a toolbox of creatures to control the board, such as Collector Ouphe and Endurance. The key strategy is to generate massive amounts of mana with Gaea's Cradle to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and disruption, while also maintaining a strong defense with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Allosaurus Shepherd.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt opponents by locking them out of their non-basic lands with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while also playing aggressive creatures like Fury and Pyrogoyf to put pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to take advantage of fast mana acceleration and the synergies between artifact spells and cards with suspend to overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to recover. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Sundering Eruption and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker helps ensure victory in the mid to late game.

The main concept of this deck is to apply heavy pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Amped Raptor, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize. The deck also has efficient removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Goblin Bombardment. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide additional support and synergy for the aggressive creatures in the deck. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy while also incorporating some disruptive lands like Wasteland and Karakas.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then bringing them back onto the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also utilizes control elements like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The mana base includes fetch lands like Polluted Delta and Underground Sea to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently reanimate threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then use Reanimate spells to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to win through powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, while also having options like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for additional value and card advantage. The key strategy is to quickly reanimate high-impact creatures and overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm your opponent with a mixture of creature-based threats and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to disrupt your opponent's game plan, as well as cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to deal direct damage and generate additional value from your creatures, this deck aims to put constant pressure on the opponent and force them to react defensively. With a mix of removal, disruptive spells, and powerful creatures, this deck is designed to keep the opponent on their back foot and ultimately secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly using cards like Chrome Mox, Dark Ritual, and Mox Opal, while disrupting the opponent's hand with Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to assemble a powerful storm combo using cards like Infernal Tutor and Ad Nauseam to find win conditions like Tendrils of Agony or Burning Wish. The inclusion of Wishclaw Talisman and Vault of Whispers allows for additional tutoring and ramp. The deck also utilizes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Cabal Ritual to generate more mana for explosive plays. The deck is designed to create a powerful storm win condition and overwhelm the opponent before they can effectively respond.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands to control the game, with key cards like Dark Depths, Urza's Saga, Wasteland, and Exploration. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by consistently generating mana and leveraging land-based abilities to gain advantage. By manipulating the battlefield with cards like Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam, the deck can outvalue and outmaneuver opponents, ultimately leading to victory through attrition and resource denial. The inclusion of various utility lands and disruptive spells further solidify its control-oriented strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly set up the powerful combo of Show and Tell and Omniscience to cheat out big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck aims to use cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Intuition to find key pieces of the combo while using counterspells like Force of Will to protect it. With City of Traitors and Lotus Petal providing additional ramp, the deck can effectively get its game-winning combo off as early as possible in order to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature aggression and disruptive spells. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride. The inclusion of Goblin Bombardment allows for additional direct damage and removal, further enhancing the aggressive playstyle of the deck. Additionally, the land base is designed to provide a good balance of mana fixing and disruption through cards like Wasteland and Karakas.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands and control elements to disrupt opponents while generating strong board presence with cards like Dark Depths and Urza's Saga. It aims to control the game through land destruction with cards like Wasteland and disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Pithing Needle and Boseiju, Who Endures. The deck also has defensive options like Grafdigger's Cage and Maze of Ith to protect itself. The key strategy is to outlast opponents by creating a locked-down board state and overwhelming them with powerful creatures and control elements.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to efficiently control the game with a combination of counter spells, removal, and hand disruption. The deck includes a variety of versatile cards like Lightning Bolt, Thoughtseize, Orcish Bowmasters, Baleful Strix, and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to remove threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With efficient card draw and selection like Brainstorm and Ponder, along with powerful finishers like LÃ³rien Revealed and Murktide Regent, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy game.
